intro: Elytropus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy elytropus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Elytropus pubescens is often found in meadows and along the edges of woodlands.
